verses.text: While Israel stayed in Shittim, the people began to have sexual relations with the daughters of Moab.
verses.comment: Preserves original wording and context; 'played the harlot' translated as 'sexual relations' for clarity.

verses.text: These women invited the people to the sacrifices of their gods, and the people ate and bowed down to their gods.
So Israel joined themselves to Baal of Peor, and the anger of the Lord was kindled against Israel.
verses.comment: 'Joined themselves' translates the sense of 'yoked'; Baal of Peor left as specific.

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, 'Take all the leaders of the people and hang them in the sunlight before the Lord, so that the fierce anger of the Lord may turn away from Israel.'
verses.comment: Hang them reflects 'impale' or 'execute and expose publicly.'

verses.text: So Moses said to the judges of Israel, 'Each of you kill those of his men who have joined themselves to Baal of Peor.'
verses.comment: Kept structure of the Hebrew for direct speech.

verses.text: And just then, one of the sons of Israel came and brought a Midianite woman to his brothers, in the sight of Moses and all the congregation of the sons of Israel, while they were weeping at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
verses.comment: 'Tent of Meeting' is used as the standard phrase.

verses.text: When Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he got up from the congregation, took a spear in his hand,
went after the Israelite man into the tent and pierced both of them through—the man of Israel and the woman—through her belly. Then the plague on the sons of Israel was stopped.
verses.comment: Describes the act succinctly as in original.

verses.text: Nevertheless, those who died by the plague were twenty-four thousand.
verses.comment: 'Twenty-four thousand' is the precise Hebrew number; 1 Cor. 10:8 says twenty-three thousand.

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

'Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, has turned my wrath away from the sons of Israel by being zealous with my zeal among them, so that I did not consume the sons of Israel in my jealousy.'
verses.comment: 'Zealous with my zeal' is a literal rendering.

verses.text: 'Therefore say: Behold, I give to him my covenant of peace.'
'And it will be to him and to his descendants after him, a covenant of everlasting priesthood, because he was zealous for his God and made atonement for the sons of Israel.'
verses.comment: 'Everlasting priesthood' for literal Hebrew 'priesthood of eternity.'

verses.text: Now the name of the man of Israel who was killed with the Midianite woman was Zimri son of Salu, a leader of a father's house among the Simeonites.
verses.comment: 'Leader of a father's house' retained for accuracy.

verses.text: The name of the Midianite woman who was killed was Cozbi the daughter of Zur, who was head of the people of a father's house in Midian.
verses.comment: Faithful to Hebrew; proper names preserved.

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
'Treat the Midianites as enemies and attack them,
verses.comment: 'Attack them' renders 'strike them' in clear modern English.

verses.text: for they have harassed you with their schemes by which they deceived you in the matter of Peor, and in the matter of Cozbi, the daughter of the leader of Midian, their sister, who was killed on the day of the plague because of Peor.'
verses.comment: 'Harassed you' and 'deceived you' match Hebrew roots; 'in the matter of' is literal.
